text.content:
Travellers and NPCs can be dragged onto a spacecraft to assign them as passengers. They can then be promoted to crew members.

Each crew member can be granted one or more roles. A role allows the crew member to perform actions directly from the spacecraft sheet, with predefined difficulties and modifiers.

Creating a Role

To create a new role, create a "Crew Role" item, and give it a name. Actions can then be added to the role depending on what you want the role to do.

Chat

A chat action will simply output a message to the chat. This can be used for describing actions or flavour text.

Skill

A skill action will make a skill check using the crew member's own skills. You can select the skill to be rolled, along with optionally specificying a characteristic to use (otherwise the character's default will be used for that skill).

You can set a skill target number (defaults to 8) and specify a DM to apply to the check. Specifying a target of 6 or adding a DM of +2 have much the same effect, but conceptually they can be different.

A Jump astrogation check is dificulty 4, with a -1 DM per parsec of distance, so you could either specify a target of 5 for a 1 parsec jump, or set the target to 4 with a DM of -1.

Weapon

You can assign a weapon to be fired. This requires selecting a weapon from the ship, so until the role is applied to the ship weapon attacks can't be set up.

For a role assigned to a ship, you will be given a list of weapon mounts to select from.

Assign Role to Ship

Dragging the crew role item to a ship will add it to the list of available roles. These are listed on the Notes tab of the spacecraft's sheet.

A role can be edited or deleted from this tab.

Assign Role to Crew

To assign a role to a crew member, go to the Crew tab and edit a crew member. You will be given a list of available roles to select from. A crew member can have multiple roles assigned to them.

Once a role is assigned, a button for each task will appear on that crew member's entry. Click it to perform the action.

Adding weapons to a spacecraft is a four step process.

  1. Add a spacecraft scale weapon to the ship.

  2. Create a mount point for the weapon.

  3. Assign the weapon to the mount.

  4. Assign a role to a crew member to fire the weapon.

Add Weapon to Spacecraft

If a Weapon item with a scale of 'Spacecraft' is dragged onto the ship's sheet, then it will be made available for adding to mount points. A weapon can be assigned to multiple mounts, so you only need to add one of each weapon type.

The full list of available weapons is displayed in the Notes tab of a spacecraft's sheet.

Create a Mount

Add a hardware item of type Weapon. This creates a weapon mounting (such as a turret, bay or spinal mount) which can have a weapon assigned to it.

Weapon mounts appear in the Hardware tab of a spacecraft.

Assign Weapon to Mount

If you edit the weapon mount, then you should see a list of available weapons that can be assigned to that weapon. Weapons need to have the same mounting type. So a Small Bay weapon mount will only display weapons with a mount type of Small Bay.

You can normally add only a single weapon to a mount. The exception is for double, triple and quad turrets that allow multiple weapons to be assigned (or the same weapon to be assigned multiple times).

You can increase the quantity of weapon mounts, which means that there are multiple different turrets or bays with that type of weapon.

Assign a Role

Once a weapon has been setup and added to a mount, you can then assign that weapon to the 'Weapon' task in a crew role.

Hardware is core to the design of a spacecraft. Hardware are items which provide reactors, manouevre drives, jump drives, cargo, bridges and computers for a spacecraft.

In order to configure a spacecraft beyond the basic hull, you need to add hardware.

In the hardware tab, it is possible to add basic hardware types using the 'Add Hardware' menu. Other types of hardware will need to be defined and dropped in from elsewhere.

The statistics at the top of the sheet for things such as cargo space, J-Drive and M-Drive rating etc will be automatically set once the hardware items have been added.

Tonnage for general system items can be calculated in a variety of ways.

Legacy versions (up to 0.13.5) only supported `pcByRating`. Since 0.13.6, there are a number of different options.

Common Values

Tons: A fixed value. The item takes up this amount of tonnage, plus anything that is calculated.

MCr/TON: The Cost of the item in MCr per ton it consumes.

Calculation

Percentage By Rating (pcByRating)

The item takes up tonnage equal to the rating of the item multiplied by the percentage of the hull.

Percentage: 10

The item will consume 10% of the hull tonnage for each point of rating.

Percentage by Hull (pcByHull)

The item takes up a fixed percentage of the hull tonnage. The rating is ignored.
